text:
This seems to happen only in the case of Linux 7.2 I got all the bundles (rpm) from the apache site archive and installed it in using rm -Uvh *.rpm (*.rpm includes ->ant,xerces,tomcat,tomcat-webapps,tomcat-connectors) I am using JDK1.4.0 and the the xerces that is bundled with the Tomcat 4.0.3 When a JSP document is accessed I get an error that says: Apache Tomcat/4.0.3 - Error report

Apache Tomcat/4.0.3 - HTTP Status 500 - Internal Server Error

type Exception report

message Internal Server Error

description The server encountered an internal error (Internal Server Error) that prevented it from fulfilling this request.

exception 

javax.servlet.ServletException: (class:
org/apache/jasper/compiler/ParserXJspSaxHandler$Node, method:  signature:
(Lorg/apache/jasper/compiler/ParserXJspSaxHandler;Lorg/apache/jasper/compiler/ParserXJspSaxHandler$Node;)V)
Expecting to find object/array on stack

creator: prasad.subramanian@sun.com

text:
I don't know what to do with this report, as I'm not able to reproduce it. It
may be caused by some class conflict, or maybe the installation of Tomcat is
incorrect. Tomcat 4.1.x may also not have this problem.
creator: remm@apache.org

text:
Apparently the problem happens only when you install using the rpm files.
I isntalled the binaries using the tar.gz  versions from the same location and
this problem did not occur.

Can anyone help me to locate the exact problem ?
creator: prasad.subramanian@sun.com
medthomas@ntlworld.com
text:
Not sure if this is a bug or not but I am closing this as WONTFIX as:
- Remy couldn't reproduce it
- RPMs are now maintained by JPackage (www.jpackage.org)
